tldr: Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to credential leakage due to improper sanitization of the `Authorization` header. When forwarding client requests to upstream providers, the header was not removed, causing client credentials to be exposed to third-party APIs. The fix ensures that client `Authorization` headers are stripped when provider credentials are present.
doest_this_affect_me: You are affected if you are using a version that falls within the vulnerable range.
how_to_fix: Upgrade the `better-ccflare` library to the patch version.
